item.title: RankLLM: Weighted Ranking of LLMs by Quantifying Question Difficulty
item.description: arXiv:2602.12424v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Benchmarks establish a standardized evaluation framework to systematically assess the performance of large language models (LLMs), facilitating objective comparisons and driving advancements in the field. However, existing benchmarks fail to different...<br><br><small><strong>Source:</strong> arXiv | <strong>Keywords:</strong> framework, arxiv, model, large language model, LLM | <strong>Relevance:</strong> 100%</small>

item.title: A Theoretical Framework for Adaptive Utility-Weighted Benchmarking
item.description: arXiv:2602.12356v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Benchmarking has long served as a foundational practice in machine learning and, increasingly, in modern AI systems such as large language models, where shared tasks, metrics, and leaderboards offer a common basis for measuring progress and comparing ...<br><br><small><strong>Source:</strong> arXiv | <strong>Keywords:</strong> framework, arxiv, model, context, large language model | <strong>Relevance:</strong> 100%</small>

item.title: OptiML: An End-to-End Framework for Program Synthesis and CUDA Kernel Optimization
item.description: arXiv:2602.12305v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Generating high-performance CUDA kernels remains challenging due to the need to navigate a combinatorial space of low-level transformations under noisy and expensive hardware feedback. Although large language models can synthesize functionally correct...<br><br><small><strong>Source:</strong> arXiv | <strong>Keywords:</strong> framework, arxiv, model, large language model, LLM | <strong>Relevance:</strong> 100%</small>
item.author: noreply@contextengineering.news (arXiv)

item.title: mcp-context-forge - A Model Context Protocol (MCP) Gateway & Registry. Serves as a central management point for tools, resources, and prompts that can be accessed by MCP-compatible LLM applications. Converts REST API endpoints to MCP, composes virtual MCP servers with added security and observability, and converts between protocols (stdio, SSE, Streamable HTTP).
item.description: A Model Context Protocol (MCP) Gateway & Registry. Serves as a central management point for tools, resources, and prompts that can be accessed by MCP-compatible LLM applications. Converts REST API endpoints to MCP, composes virtual MCP servers with added security and observability, and converts between protocols (stdio, SSE, Streamable HTTP).<br><br><small><strong>Source:</strong> GitHub | <strong>Keywords:</strong> model, context, API, LLM, prompt | <strong>Relevance:</strong> 100%</small>

item.title: Evolving Beyond Snapshots: Harmonizing Structure and Sequence via Entity State Tuning for Temporal Knowledge Graph Forecasting
item.description: arXiv:2602.12389v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Temporal knowledge graph (TKG) forecasting requires predicting future facts by jointly modeling structural dependencies within each snapshot and temporal evolution across snapshots. However, most existing methods are stateless: they recompute entity r...<br><br><small><strong>Source:</strong> arXiv | <strong>Keywords:</strong> memory, framework, arxiv, experiment, model | <strong>Relevance:</strong> 80%</small>

item.title: Unleashing Low-Bit Inference on Ascend NPUs: A Comprehensive Evaluation of HiFloat Formats
item.description: arXiv:2602.12635v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: As LLMs scale, low-bit floating-point formats like MXFP and NVFP4 offer new opportunities for precision and efficiency. In this work, we evaluate HiFloat (HiF8 and HiF4), a family of formats tailored for Ascend NPUs. Through rigorous comparison across...<br><br><small><strong>Source:</strong> arXiv | <strong>Keywords:</strong> framework, arxiv, LLM | <strong>Relevance:</strong> 60%</small>
